meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a small number of items or a small quantity.
meanings.sent1: The paucal group of friends gathered for a cozy movie night.
meanings.sent2: She only had a paucal amount of coins in her purse.
meanings.sent3: The paucal cupcakes on the table disappeared in seconds.
meanings.sent4: His paucal knowledge of gardening bloomed into a beautiful hobby.
meanings.sent5: The paucal stars in the sky twinkled brightly on the clear night.

meanings.sent1: The paucal of apples in the basket was just enough for a snack.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a paucal of birds perched on the tree branches.
meanings.sent3: The paucal of pencils on her desk seemed to multiply overnight.
meanings.sent4: The paucal of students in the classroom made for an intimate learning environment.
meanings.sent5: She carefully counted the paucal of seashells she collected on the beach.
